comment: This professor is obviously knowledgeable, but he does not share any of that knowledge with you. He expects you to read the book, understand the material, and put that out on a test. There's very little organization, and so you must be prepared to organize yourself. The work load is a little ridiculous for a 2 hour class.

In opposition to the rest of the posts here my experience with him as an online teacher was a pleasant one. He was far from unreasonable, generally gets back to you in a timely manner of you have a question, and willing to help- something I rarely see in college professors. He expects a lot of work for a 2 credit hour class, and one negative thing I will say is that he swore up and down that he was going to curve heavily on the exams but it ended up being only 10 points or so.

Oh WOW if you see this please I beg u do NOT take his online anth course. There is no note, nothing, w/e he gives are from websites. No direction, boring discussion. its like ur paying $200 online course fee for having someone to tell you "read the book and talk about it." srsly, DO NOT TAKE HIS COURSE!

Not recommended. Online course, no participation from the prof. Annoying glitches: tests posted incorrectly, obsolete material. Weekly reading consists of 1-2 chapters, 3-4 articles, multiple websites. 3 multiple choice tests. Journal required: 15 essay type questions per week. Look elsewhere for this 2 credit course.

I took his online course. If you are self-motivated and can get things done, then take this professor. He gives little direction, but he doesn't grade harshly and is easy. I made an A  and hardly ever opened my book. If you can't read a syllabus and follow directions/timelines then don't take this class.

This was an online course with little direction. You get a complete syllabus at the beginning and the rest is up to you. Be prepared to teach yourself. He does check and answer e-mails but does not participate in any discussions or give any feedback. Not an easy course.

Very interesting class. I took it during summer semester online and got an A. His tests are based mostly on the book so if you read it carefully once or twice and make good notes you will score high. Journal is not too hard if you do it regularly. I did not and was stock with lots of writing in the end of the semester. He grades fairly

I took the internet class and it was very interesting. He adds extra point to the tests if class does not do too well. As long as you read your book and highlight important part you will be ok. You have to write a journal which is not too difficult but may be time consuming. It took me some work to get an A. The class was really not too bad.

This professor is the worst ever.  No Direction; So many curves that it will make you sick.  This professor should not teach...and does not teach.  kEEP Your Money...take someone else.  Tests are not organized...BIG MISTAKE TAKING THIS Professor.

Refuses to give any direction and insists that you get direction from your classmates who are just a lost as you are.  This material should be an easy, no-brainer yet somehow he made it uninteresting and difficult.

I took an online section. ANTHROPOLOGY 2105 = EVOLUTION 2105 ... at least according to Stockton. The (lengthy) section on evolution just didn't *fit*--all the other units were very general anthropological topics. The evolution unit was extremely detailed (you'll read more for this unit than every other unit combined). Tough tests, but he curves.

he gave us no direction AT ALL and his excuse was there was no material from the publisher. we were told to just read a chapter a week and then take a test. then we had to do a research paper on an object like a mailbox or a chair. i followed the sylabus exactly yet i got a 75 with no explanation at all! our final was posted 8 hours late too!!

Terrible - Do yourself a big favor – DO NOT take this professor unless you want enjoy chaos and busy work. He teaches nothing and tests are incredibly difficult. You never know where you stand “grade wise” because of the unexplained curves used in grading.
worst professor ever. He is the king of them all. If you want to make a decent grade in this class, TAKE SOMEONE ELSE, DO NOT AND I REPEAT DO NOT TAKE HIM

He's new and a bit disorganized. Tests are hard, but at least they're multiple choice. There's a lot of reading. Typical leftist professor. Readings are culled from heavily slanted sources. Journal questions showcase his hostility toward conservatism.
